title.value: Age-related bias and artificial intelligence: a scoping review
title.justification: It is the main title of the paper.
title.quote: Age-related bias and artificial intelligence: a scoping review

extractions.description: This paper conducts a scoping review to explore age-related bias in artificial intelligence systems. It identifies how these systems encode, produce, or reinforce age-related bias and discusses the social, ethical, and legal implications. The review includes analysis based on a comprehensive search strategy, covering both academic and grey literature sources.

type.justification: The paper involves a systematic review of existing literature, gathering empirical evidence on the presence and impact of age-related bias in AI systems.
type.quote:
This scoping review aims to answer the following research questions:
1. What is known about age-related bias in AI technology?
2. What literature exists on the extent of age-related bias in AI systems?
3. How do AI systems encode, produce, or reinforce age-related bias?
4. What are the societal, legal, and ethical implications of age-related bias in AI systems?
5. What is the state of knowledge on older people’s experiences of age related bias in AI systems?

name.justification: The primary focus is on identifying and analyzing age-related biases in AI systems, which falls under the study of fairness and bias in AI.
name.quote:
The term ‘AI’ has existed for over 50 years (Smith et al. 2006), so the publication
date was not limited by the year of publication. Exclusion criteria included papers
with non-human subjects (e.g., animals, agriculture), theses, dissertations, conference
abstracts, non-peer reviewed conference proceedings, perspectives/editorials, books,
book chapters, and letters to editors.

name.justification: The paper focuses specifically on biases encountered in AI systems related to age, coining the term 'digital ageism'.
name.quote: Digital ageism refers to ageism reﬂected design, development, and implementation of AI systems and technologies and its resultant data.

name.justification: Two of the main applications examined in the paper are age recognition and facial recognition systems.
name.quote: The most common AI applications that intersected with age were age recognition and facial recognition systems.

name.justification: The paper cites CNNs as one of the primary algorithms used in the AI systems being reviewed.
name.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

is_contributed.justification: CNNs are mentioned as existing models commonly used in the reviewed literature, not as a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not detail execution specifics of CNNs but only mentions their usage in the context of existing literature.
is_executed.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

is_compared.justification: The paper mentions the usage of CNNs but does not compare CNN specifics numerically against other models in its review.
is_compared.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not refer to a specific CNN model paper in its literature review.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

name.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

is_contributed.justification: SVMs are discussed as existing models commonly used in the reviewed literature, not as a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not detail execution specifics of SVMs but merely mentions their usage in the context of existing literature.
is_executed.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

is_compared.justification: The paper mentions the usage of SVMs but does not numerically compare them against other models in its review.
is_compared.quote: The most frequent machine learning algorithms used were convolutional neural networks and support vector machines.

name.justification: MORPH is the most frequently mentioned dataset in the paper for age and facial recognition research.
name.quote: The most used databases were MORPH (n = 16) (Abdurrahim et al., 2018; Alexander and Logashanmugam, 2016; Georgopoulos et al., 2020a; Georgopoulos et al., 2020b; Kuang et al., 2015; Li et al., 2017 Liu et al., 2015; Rodriguez et al., 2017; Smith and Ricanek, 2020; Smith-Miles and Geng, 2020; Sun et al., 2020; Terhörst et al., 2020; Tian et al., 2020; Wang and Kambhamettu, 2015; Xie and Hsu, 2020; Zou et al., 2016).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The datasets are discussed without specific reference to their own papers.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The most used databases were MORPH (n = 16) (Abdurrahim et al., 2018; Alexander and Logashanmugam, 2016; Georgopoulos et al., 2020a; Georgopoulos et al., 2020b; Kuang et al., 2015; Li et al., 2017 Liu et al., 2015; Rodriguez et al., 2017; Smith and Ricanek, 2020; Smith-Miles and Geng, 2020; Sun et al., 2020; Terhörst et al., 2020; Tian et al., 2020; Wang and Kambhamettu, 2015; Xie and Hsu, 2020; Zou et al., 2016).
